message: About 1 out of 5 times auto-complete - whether I call it by shortcut or it automatically comes up - will lock up the entire program. Sometimes its for a few seconds, sometimes its for up to two minutes. This is a huge pain in the arse. Other people I code with are reporting similar problems.
Which Eclipse plugin are you using?
ie I keep completely different versions for each type of coding I do
It happens most often when I'm doing android development.
so I don't think its the plugin
It's far less frequent than 1 in 5 for me, and only happens when I'm editing HTML in PDT
Are there any known fixes or root causes?
It also commonly happens when I'm doing java EE work in a completely different eclipse
also happens in my eclipse C ide
My friends report it heavier in Java EE than in android development.
I've had the same problem on different machines/different configurations of Eclipse. I'd say around 1 in 10

Yes, it was happening to me a lot, also during Android dev, but can be fixed. The lockups mostly have to do with the Java VM garbage collecting the Eclipse runtime. There's posts on the net on how to tweak the VM's heap parameters in Eclipse.ini to minimize this. Tweaking the completion preferences also helped.

In the end I doubled my RAM and that more-less completely eliminated it (you will still see it at startup, because Eclipse has plenty of load-on-demand code, until things get cached and JITed)
